reviews_data.review_text: Coffee and environment is always good
Really nice place!! Very cozy. The coffee was good, the cronut was good, even though it was coated with too much sugar, the banana bread was delicious. It was a great way to start our morning.
This joint has the best pastries in uptown, along with great coffee!
The best latte in my life!!!
Great coffee, amazing location, cozy vibe

Decided to try a different coffee spot than my usual go-to on the weekends. It's cozy and unique, but the coffee was BAD and the service so-so. My husband got a regular drip coffee which tasted like nothing. I ordered an Americano with sugar free vanilla. I watched the barista pour wayyy too much syrup in the cup (I was a barista for 5 years so I have a good idea about how much goes in a 16oz cup) and then watched 2 or 3 more drinks that were ordered after me get made and handed out before mine. They were relatively busy, with a line of 3 people pretty consistently, so I don't mind waiting for my coffee in those situations. However, the drink was so gross it didn't redeem the wait. I had my husband try it to make sure I wasn't being overly critical and he suggested I throw it away. We left and tossed our drinks and went to another coffee shop. Won't be visiting this spot again.
Lots of seating. Drinks and food were delicious. Perfect experience for a rainy day in the city.
Best place to study and work. Coffee is good!
No option to tip workers while using a card, coffee tastes like water
Good coffee and pastry.
Breakfast sandwiches are definitely delicious and the place is comfortable and inviting.

The cronuts are amazing.  The cream filled is outstanding and not too sweet.  Good coffee.  My only complaint is that the breakfast sandwiches take a while to come out and I think maybe they forgot.  It was not busy on a Monday at 8:15am.
Really cute little shop. Slow but worth the wait if you have the time. I got hot chocolate and it was nice and creamy and a little on the dark side rather than sweet.

This coffee shop is the absolute cutest. Latte with sugar free hazelnut was perfect! Sausage, egg and cheese English muffin was sooo good!! Fresh made to order eggs. I love the different seating areas in here, and sections. There's an area with pillow seats, and another side with lounge chairs and tables. Really enjoyed our coffee and breakfast. Baristas we're also so friendly and nice!! Will be back.
Everything was nice except coffee was not very hot for 6:30 in the morning.
Great atmosphere and vibe. Coffee and variations are fantastic.
Friendly atmosphere and an easy place to read, study, or hangout.
I work across the street and find myself getting coffee here when I have time and the baristas and cashiers are always so nice! A very welcoming space to chill as well.
It's really cool place with a nice atmosphere, a good place to work with a laptop. But their coffee isn't so good
Try the hunnybun latte. Soooo tasty!!

Awful. just plain awful. Terrible customer service, and subpar coffee. I can't believe the unprofessionalism at the front counter (you're met with utter disdain and condescension). Everyone behind is so snarky and nasty. The joy now is telling all my friends to avoid this place!
Coffee was so so. And there were no coco. Weird store name with no coco.

This used to be my favorite coffee shop in Uptown until my two most recent incidents. Just completely awful, reckless customer service. First incident was with a blond girl wearing a hoodie with a rainbow at the front counter; second incident was with a black man at the front counter.  Problem A: Both times when I asked for my drink of choice ("Could I have a ____") they responded with something to the rude tune of "Yeah no." The second encounter I was thrown off by how dismissive he was; both times they just kept staring at me like I was the one who was foolish. How am I supposed to know what's out of stock? That's your job to inform me, do so respectfully, and perhaps offer a suggestion. So instead had to re-pivot and offer a second choice, without any input from them. Again just poor customer service based on their reactions.  Problem B: In that second incident, after I ordered, I moved to the right to wait for my order; a customer came over afterward and told me she had heard the blond girl and black man (at the front counter) talking smack about me. They were condescending to what I was wearing and how I wasn't entertaining their flippant manner with my demeanor.  Seriously have these two ever gone through customer service training? How can the Marriott endorsement this terrible behavior? The baristas here used to be so sweet (one used to remember my name) and now they're moody, condescending, and just awful to deal with. Will happily take my money to Night Swim or the cafe in the Ritz. Bye bye.
Delicious coffees with strong flavor and comfortable rustic decor with unique seating areas for cool ambiance.
the place was not crowded and they took 15 minutes or more to do my smoothie. nice place but all durty
Service is slow and my breakfast sandwich looks like someone sat on it.     That being said, the sandwich and coffee was good.
Great place to sit and enjoy a snack. The banana bread is very good.
Great spot to get coffee uptown. Really a fun overall space too.  Great place to meet or study

I love this place.  Came Sunday at noon on September 11. Yummy food and coffee.  Amazing service… I wish I would've gotten their names but shout out to my “hot sauce in my bag” ladies with fabulous pastel pink hair and amazing blue winged eyeliner!!
Dope interior space with a great ambiance. Iced coffee was strong, which is an automatic five from me.

A totally unique setting, very original and cozy with lots of space.  The menu is pretty big, however the food/drinks take is just OK and nothing to rave about.  The staff was pretty friendly except for the cashier who looked brand new and did not know what she was doing.  Still good enough to grab something on the go
Great coffee house. I live their iced chai.

Visiting from out of town. Drove into the city just to try this place.. It has taken almost an hour since we arrived to wait in line, place order, and now still waiting on food/drinks. At 10am on a Sunday. Just writing this to let others know to expect a wait.. not a quick service type of place. Otherwise the pasties were bomb and I am hopeful for the coffee but haven't received it yet :)

Great location and atmosphere. Pricey but expected with location being in the city.  If you are staying at the Marriott, there is access from within.  Would have given 5 stars if service was more efficient (long lines) and ability to customize breakfast sandwiches (basically warm pre-made and give to you).  Cronuts were the highlight!

Would give 4 stars based on wait time and ease of the experience but the pastries and coffee were definitely 5/5 and the staff were nice.  We ordered two pour overs, the blueberry muffin, and the donut cronut. Doesn't seem like only a take-out place but they didn't ask if it was for here or to-go and I couldn't eat the cronut donut out of the large box so we had to ask for a plate. We were told the pour overs would take 5 minutes, not a big deal at all but it took 18 minutes 😬.  Worth the wait but room for improvement.
Bacon egg croissant was good. The dirty Chai tea awful.
Great coffee place - the cafe has lots of fun seating and the drip coffee was really nice - it was a Tanzanian blend. Try the cinnamon sugar cronut - what a treat!

Very cool place but their coffee wasn't the best! It is for sure a very nice atmosphere and environment… however, they could do better with the quality of easy products. Their cold brew was very average
It was perfect! They let me pee on the floor there!
Absolutely love coming here! Great place to work when you don't want to work from home, delicious treats and drinks to accompany a busy and focused work day

The coolest coffee shop in Charlotte. I feel like I'm in NYC when I'm sitting inside, they have such a unique setup for seating. I always get an iced mocha, and it's a perfectly balanced blend of espresso, chocolate, and sugar.

This place is everything you want a coffee shop to be. Long hang outs… pillows, tables, chairs, alternative seating, artisanal baked goods, grab and go snacks, Wi-Fi, and a thousand charging stations.

The feng shui is generally good - there is ample, varied space to create your own experience. That is the highlight of this cafe. On the drinks end, the espresso I had was so acidic I thought i was drinking battery juice. Meanwhile, my partners chai favored the sweeter side of life, but not all things can be so sweet.

Coco and the Director is literally one of my favorite spots to get coffee in Uptown. You wouldn't even be able to tell that attached to the hotel because that's how amazing it is.  The inside of the shop is absolutely beautiful. Super boho vibey and the perfect spot to lounge with your laptop. I love all of the cool seating that they have. I visit Coco & the Director at least once a week or once every other week and get the same thing everytime, but I know for a fact the other options are great also. My order is an Iced Latte with vanilla bean & mocha syrup with light ice - absolutely delicious!!!

Charged $75 for a cup of coffee. Went to the location and spoke with a manager. She agreed it was an error, would resolve, and would follow up with me. Left my contact info but never heard anything. Called over a week later and left messages asking her to call me back for an update. Coffee is fine but $75/cup is too steep.
Stopped by for espressos, good coffee and fast service. No parking around there

Definitely not as good as I expected.  Breakfast sandwiches are microwaved and limited to two options (which is fine for a coffee shop) and not at all customizable, just wanted to swap English muffin for croissant but absolutely not, since they are pre made and microwaved.  Didn't get to try baked goods as cronut wasn't put on our order and didn't catch that until after it was rung up and our food came out because the cashier didn't repeat anything.  Definitely not going back.

The decor was really charming and they had a pretty expansive drink menu. This is however one of the most average coffee shops I've ever been to. The service was just okay and I'm attributing that to the employees being overwhelmed, therefore no harm no foul there. Their breakfast options were a bit basic, though not bad. If you're close by and need coffee and a quick breakfast you're in luck.
Good
Very clean and orderly.
Reasonably priced, excellent service, kind of cute service 2, and quite Frankly,  The best bacon egg and cheese croissant I've ever had

I'd give it 10 ⭐️s if it wasn't a hassle to get to, park, and find it open.  The hours on google are off, the hours listed by the university are of, the hours on the damn DOOR are off from any ACTUAL hours.  I've driven here for no reason for the last time. Sigh.  I wish them the best tho. 🙁😞
Very unique spot and loved the vibe in there. Pretty quiet. In the middle of tall buildings.
The cinnamon brown sugar latte is the best in town! Love the aesthetics as well.
OMG! This Rose Bud Latte is 😍🤤😛 Thank you!!!
I love the environment, nice and quiet!  Service was good and both drinks, Hot Latte and Ice Matcha Latte, were awsome.
Staff is so great and friendly!  Even on a busy day, Emilie made a great Chai latte.

The cafe itself had an inviting and relaxing vibe. The staff were welcoming. I was able to relax, charge my devices and watch a movie on the big screen while I drank my iced chai latte which I was very happy with. I also had a muffin and if was delicious.

Really cool vibe here. Coffee is great. Just don't order food and you're golden. Their menu specifically says no substitutions on the breakfast sandwiches because they are premade. It took them 20 minutes to get me a premade breakfast sandwich. Absolutely absurd.
Love the kind staff here! Always friendly and fast service. The sausage, egg and cheese sandwich is awesome! Relaxing atmosphere with lots of cozy seating.
IT'S JUST DIFFERENT! In a good way
Love the atmosphere
Very kind staff, great coffee drinks and pastries!
Great place to get a coffee and work
Love the lattes here! The environment is also very nice. Only downside there is no street parking so you will have to walk quite a bit.
Nice place with a cool setting for a casual conversation or some business meetings. The cappuccino was excellent.
(Translated by Google) The environment is very nice and the coffee is also good. Went in the morning, the choice of bread was a bit small. recommend!  (Original) 环境非常好，咖啡也不错。早上去的，面包的选择有点少。推荐！
Good coffee, good staff! Good place to work😊

When I go to a Cafe the one thing that bothers me the most is the one size option. If I wanted a small cup of coffee I would order a small. I asked for a larger latte and when I saw the cup I said I ordered a large latte She said this is the only size we offer. And I ordered a pastry. It was hard as a rock. We were there for a work meeting. And we ordered a few items for our staff. We all had purchased something to eat. I then asked for a plate she looked under wherever they should be and she said were all out.. They were all dirty. So they handed me a stack of to go boxes. Honestly I was really disappointed. I would say maybe next time. But I won't be coming back. Take care of your place. Customer service is a crucial part of today's broken world. All I Wanted Was A Large Cup of Coffee

*Updated Review*  Changing my review to a 4-Star as the owner is on top of things and trying to make it right. Nice atmosphere, coffee was just okay, and service was lacking. Was hoping for a swanky coffee shop with nice coffee design as their website shows, Here's what I got...
The atmosphere and the vibe of the coffee shop are amazing! The coffee menu could use some help.
They have to Added More Food I was Disappointed
love coming here to read or work! staff is so friendly and the places itself is really nice!

I love checking out new coffee shops. I won't be back here.  Prices were comparable. The latte was mediocre. It tasted fine, just didn't impress me. Wasn't much in the way of food but they had plenty of beer and a good selection of coffee. Ordered a chocolate muffin as well, waited 10 minutes before anyone said anything to me (mind you it took close to 5 just for the latte and there was one couple in front of me). The guy who asked had just gotten there while the guy who took my order was ready to leave but got told to clean lids and straws.  The environment is cool and plenty of seating. A very relaxed vibe. But the tables near the window hadn't been cleaned.  It's in a great location, especially for people at the Marriott, but not worth more than one visit.  Also...$15 for a French press!?
Great coffee and cronuts!
Come for the coffee, but stay for the great ambiance and seating. Great place to meet or work on a project.
Ordered 3 cappuccinos. Bit inconsistent flavor. Service was slow on the frontend and the backend. Asian Chicken Wrap was good.
Two stars for the place coffee wasn't the best
Really good working space and the staff are super chill.

great little cafe in the Marriot. my lazy a$$ hates going out so it was nice to be able to grab literally any kind of snack i could want from cocos — the kombucha was yummy from Lenny Boy, and they have Zapp's chips which are honestly the best in the world.  from coffee to pastries to salads. great spot for lunch, etc.
Breakfast sandwiches are yummy!
I stop by every time I visit Charlotte. Excellent service and a terrific selection of coffee drinks and breakfast food! Definitely will return!!!
In town and had to try this coffee shop I heard about. I really liked my iced mocha but I was hoping for more variety in drinks.
Pretty bad coffee
The good:  1. Great decoration 2. Good location 3. Friendly staff 4. Good pastries  and muffins  The not so good:  1. Was really hoping for a better quality coffee. Nothing really espectacular.
Cute, good smoothies. Not many food options but plenty of coffee. Thank you for being open during the snow storm.
Awesome little coffee shop
Hire a barista who knows how to make a good coffee. Asked for a strong latte, the coffee tasted like milk both the time. Waste of $6.50

The cronuts are to die for, coffee and smoothies are great also. I love this cafe my only downfall is that they only have one location uptown (parking sucks) I would love for them to open an alternate location somewhere else around Charlotte

Service sucks. Coffee is great though. Rude workers and you might hear the phrase: “this isn't Starbucks” when you place your order. Obviously it isn't Starbucks but with attitudes like the workers have here it's more like a McDonald's experience.
This whole place is a VIBE. You have to see it for yourself.
So glad this cafe was right under our hotel. Did not miss a day without getting a latte and a chocolate croissant. Delicious, cute and cozy atmosphere.
What a cool place, full of art, nice people and good beverage. A little expensive. I got a coconut milk matcha latte 💚
Nice atmosphere, great service, and delicious coffee
The cronut was a delicacy! Plenty of seating and lots of outlets available and the music was at a great volume.
Cozy lil spot in the middle of uptown.  Come in for a hot coffee and a warm cronut. Best one on town. Perfectly flaky and sweet.

Nice for quick breakfast. Good selection of coffee, espresso, tea and a few smoothies. Some fruit, pastries, muffins, yogurt, etc. A lot of space and comfortable spots to spread out and also enough for some privacy/distance.
Good coffee and great atmosphere.  Lots of seating and electrical outlets for work.

Great experience for a local coffee shop. I loved the design of the seating when you first enter. The employees were very friendly and inviting. The drink I purchased was very delicious. I would definitely go here again if I visit Charlotte again.

I've been here a few times to work, I like to sit upstairs. They have a lot of space and seating options. The atmosphere is cool- Good for individuals and groups, work or social. I had their bacon egg and cheese breakfast croissant, I didn't get a picture because I ate it, it was really good! Their coffee is tasty also, lots of options.
Coffee and chai lattes were both very good. We also got a chocolate croissant, lemon poppy seed muffin, and a toffee cream doughnut. First two were great but the doughnut was a let down.
Fun, cozy atmosphere! Drinks were delicious and so was the pecan sticky bun. Loved the seating in tiers, very comfortable.
Love the wooden stadium seating area wuth cushions.  Smoothie was tasty, muffins were fresh and coffee was not too acidic
Great coffee!
I ordered the Hazelnut Latte and it was delicious! You can actually taste the hazelnut. The barista's were kind, helpful, and had excellent recommendations.
Stayed in Uptown for the weekend. Best coffee joint I could find.
Coffee wasn't that good. Pastries were good though

Disappointing. We went to try the Cronuts and they were sold out. The cashier talked to the couple before us about why there were none, yet when we asked about the cronuts she replied 'No, is there anything else I can get for you?' We thought it was weird that they were already out of a lot of items and they were supposed to be open until 6:00 and it was only 12:15.  We ended up ordering two crossaints and she didn't ask about warming them up. She was very short and rude with us. Made us sad since we were visiting from out of town.
Nice coffee shop. Cozy environment, good coffee, great service. Just in the city center, good for relaxing after long walk.
Love this coffee shop!!!! One of my favorite spots!
I can't even describe this place is so fancy, comfortable, quiet place to relax with your favorite kind of coffee and sweet.
This is the best coffee shop in Charlotte. Amazing quality of their products, extremely friendly staff, great atmosphere. Wouldn't go anywhere else for an iced mocha or iced chai tea.
Great place to get coffee, tea or sweets and just chill.
Our chai latte were absolutely amazing. This is a trendy and hip little coffee lounge.

It's hard to decide which is more awesome: the atmosphere, the coffee, or the people. All three come together to create one deliciously chill place that I keep finding myself drawn in to. I'll never pass up the chance to visit Coco and the Director!
Absolutely love this place.
Great spot with good coffee and food. There's lots of seating if you're looking for a place to study or get some work done.
Great place with ample space for study sessions
Just moved here and decided to check this place out and I love the atmosphere and staff here!
A nice simple coffee shop.  The decor is where it's at.
Great donut, coffee and set up
Place is closed in business hours

Halted in while going through Charlotte. Incredible climate and energies. You could come here to team up/work with others and pursue a spot first floor or wind up going through the layered advance stages which were planned flawlessly. Incredible espresso and sublime cordial assistance. We even fiddled with a portion of the new fermented free leaf lemon ginger tea. Gathering top picks incorporate the morning meal sandwiches and biscuits and ice'd mocha. Mixed and worth the stop!
Love it hereeeeee...get the banana bread
Great coffee, Relaxing atmosphere.

This place is BEAUTIFUL. The energy of the cafe is amazing! Great modern seating/lighting/ambiance and in a nice part of uptown Charlotte. That being said the coffee is Starbucks level quality while being 2 dollars more expensive, a bit burnt and very bitter. Nothing a little half and half can't fix but for an iced vanilla latte I expect it to be a bit better.
Coffee, pastry and service was top notch, fast and friendly.
Only place I could find open on Sunday morning. Coffee was terrible. 3 dollars and eighty cents for a cup that was maybe worth 25 cents. No taste.
Very nice coffee shop! Outside seating under an umbrella is special! Iced Americano was good.
10:30 Saturday Morning and they are out of cold brew coffee. Also “out of” smoothies.
Coffee is delicious
Great pastries!!! The coffee wasn't bad either. Super cute atmosphere and conveniently located on the first floor of our hotel - The Marriott.
Really cool environment and location! Coffee was great, and their muffins and doughnuts are pretty good as well.

Cute little place with a nice peaceful vibe inside not a crazy hectic coffee place which I liked. Staff was nice and the table and floors where clean. Nice selection of delicious food. The cronut was amazing it's croissant mixed with dounut. Highly recommend!
Great place to meet people for coffee!
Says they open at 6am. Nobody is even in the building and 640am.... was disappointed

What an amazing place! If you love coffe you will fall in love! They have the best flavors and convinations plust delicious pastries to accompany your coffe! To top it of the place it self is decorated beautifully it feel a little like a middle eastern style simple lines and relaxing! ❤ perfect place!! P.S.the service is also perfect!

If you're looking for somewhere to get a light breakfast in Charlotte, you've found your place. The cronuts are amazing and the coffee is just too easy to drink. Nice open, airy cafe with an unusual terrace option for seating gives it a memorable feel. If I were a local I'd be here regularly
the coffee was amazing... i will definitelly come back there

I I definitely recommend it to those who love coziness and comfort.  My favorite place is on the "steps".  Delicious coffee, always clean and comfortable, friendly staff.  One minus - they close early.

Trusted in Google to bring me somewhere good for breakfast, and did not disappoint! Perfect breakfast to start your day. Coffee is spot on. Breakfast sandwich was fantastic, and "the donut" is perfectly sweet without being overpowering (even though it looks like it could be).
Best coffee shop ever! 😍

I was one of 6 people in the store around 3pm.  One barista.  Verrah slow.  The cinnamon cronut was tough to tear off a bite.  The cold pour coffee was underwhelming.  Such a fab looking place, it's a shame that the fare disappointed.

Stopped in while traveling through Charlotte. Great atmosphere and vibes. You could come here to collaborate/work with others and sign up for a spot downstairs or find yourself going through the layered step platforms which were designed perfectly. Great coffee and superb friendly service. We even dabbled in some of the fresh brewed loose leaf lemon ginger tea. Group favorites include the breakfast sandwiches and muffins and ice'd mocha. Eclectic and worth the stop!
Always great
Good food but zero hospitality!
Was not open although website/Google said it was.
If parking wasn't such a dang nightmare and a half I'd come here all the time. Easily my favorite coffee shop vibe.
Love everything about this place. The coffee, the atmosphere and people...100% recommended!

First time to Charlotte + wanted a unique coffee experience. Definitely a great find at Coco's! Dirty Chai w/ Oat milk on point! Kind + prompt service. Lots of neat seating available from window, to cushions on stairs, or quiet tables. Art work upstairs by @2Hills entertaining. If I lived here would be my spot! Skip starbucks, come here!

Cutest, coziest coffee shop ever. The wall art was creative and gave the place a lot of character. Service was excellent & fast! We were looking for a refreshing, unique place for coffee and that's exactly what we got.

Great spot for a sandwich and coffee! We stopped in for breakfast and were not disappointed in the least. The coffee is very good; I typically just drink it black and this has a ton of taste. I didn't do a sandwich but my wife did and she really enjoyed it. Check it out!

Saw this place online while looking at local reviews and decided to try the cinnamon doughnut.  It was tasty but expensive! $6.50 to be exact.  This is big enough to split between two people for something light with coffee.  I would recommend trying it despite the steep price.
Their cronuts are amazing

Great cup of cold brew and very neat atmosphere. Plenty of seating, even if some of that is unconventional seating. Only drawback was there was a single employee working. They were super sweet and hard working, but drinks took longer as she took orders and made drinks by herself. Probably not common, but a simple cold brew did take some time. (note: this was a Sunday afternoon)

We have waited over a year to try this place and let me tell you, ITS NOT A LETDOWN. The donut is amazing. The coffee is warm and the service was super helpful and friendly. The atmosphere is calm and relaxing. We will definitely be back
Waited too long for coffee that didn't taste correct. Expired shots were used and flavor tasted watered down.

Amazing place and great coffee shop . I had bad experience with one of the African American lady with the short dreads , she was standing in front of the coffee machine.. I came in and I was just looking for menu because , it was my first time being there. The African American lady gave me pitiful ugly face expression like I didn't belong there and asked 4 different times loud “ HOW MAY I HELP YOU” .  I rushed and order , she did apologize after . However, the customer service can be better!
Great place to unwind a bit or work
Coffee was top notch. I wish they had a bit more than a few pastries. Add a few grab and go sandwiches and I'll be back more frequently
This place has such a cozy vibe to just chill and enjoy a hot cup of joe.

I wandered in here waiting to check into my hotel and I marveled at the aesthetic inside, it's built very nicely and clean. The drinks were solid, service was fast and efficient. They have like a staircase with seating alongside, as well as many tables for you to choose and enjoy. I would definitely come back again!
Delicious coffee and pastries! Try the Cronuts! Most delicious donut/croissant ever!! Friendly staff!
Amazing coffee. Excellent pastries, especially the CRONUT.
It is in a hotel so a little expensive but not too bad. I think the seating is very modern, feels like something out is a college campus. Very clean and friendly staff.
We had "the donut" - super yummy. The place itself has a very cool vibe. Not to be missed!
The space, service and coffee is excellent!  Friendly staff made my visit a must return.  Highly recommend.

I wandered in here yesterday after a recommendation from our hotel staff and was immediately charmed by the place. The decor is warm and inviting, while still being trendy and fun. Every place invites a different vibe. There's spots where you can be productive while enjoying their coffee, or snuggle up with your honey and share a croissant. The bench along the windows facing the street is heated, and for someone as cold-natured as me, that immediately became my favorite spot. I loved it so much, I brought my partner back today. He got the house coffee and is still singing its praises. The bacon egg and cheese croissant was devoured in short order. I got an iced mocha that's delicious, and a smoothie (the Pitaya Pick-me-up, I think it was called?) It was fantastic and the next time we're in Charlotte I really want to come back and try out more of the menu- including the daily sandwich, which sadly wasn't starting until noon so we missed out. :(
Fix your online hours

This place is definitely the place to go for your pick me up, whether it's early in the morning or to relax on your drive home! The aesthetic is perfect and the staff are very friendly and knowledgeable! Would recommend to a friend.
Great coffee shop plus more! Meeting spaces, artisan items for purchase, great cold drinks as well. Thoroughly enjoyed this place!

Place is fantastic. Very comfortable environment and easy to relax. Coffee was great too as they had a huge selection from your average everyday mocha to house specials. Coffee shop is directly connected to a hotel and provides for great lounge space.
The coffee is so nice with an amazing atmosphere for hanging out and talking with friends
A local favorite

Coco and the director is a great cafe located in the heart of Charlotte downtown. Their ambience and seating are brilliant. Their house brew was fine, but the banana bread was delicious. Coco and the director is a great cafe to unwind with a good book or an episode or two of a TV show.
SUCH A CUTE PLACE! The coffee was fantastic and the staff was so sweet!
Good coffee with a unique sitting area.
I love a trendy coffee lounge in an urban setting.
Amazing experience today at this beautiful coffee shop. The atmosphere was welcoming and my coffee was perfect. Andrea and Ty were both so friendly and knowledgeable. Will definitely be back.
Great coffee and relaxing atmosphere. Workers were friendly, and they had a good selection of pastries.

Great spot to get a coffee and baked good, relax, hang out, or do some work. Staff is always super nice and it's really clean inside. They even have a few beers. Definitely a cool place to check out uptown.

Love the atmosphere, the cold brew is the best I've had in Charlotte so far, and if you haven't had the cheat day decadence of their cronuts you're missing out! Once the world opens back up I will definitely be using this as a place to meet for coffee and catch up with friends.
Best coffee shop in town! Coffee is superb and so is the service from the staff. Check out the cronuts if they have them! They're made fresh daily so they sell out quick!
A really nice coffee spot with a wide variety of options. Interior is gorgeous staff is always friendly. Cold brew is fantastic as well.
The coffee is incredible and the ambiance is wonderful. I'd love to come here to work, read a book or just enjoy a hot beverage. The only issue is parking since it's located in uptown.
Great service and a great spot for morning coffee!
Love this place, Great coffee and staff. Photo next time
Might be the best cafe I've been to... ever! Not too pricy; no worse than Starbucks anyway and 10x better.

Beautiful and cozy cafe, but the worst coffee I've ever had. Too much water, wrong proportions. Very weak coffee- light brown color, tastes like nothing. I tried it twice- same result. Please, please, please, improve quality of the served drinks. It's really bad.
Americano was watery.

So. Freaking. Good. We were staying across the street at the Grand Bohemian and wanted to grab a quick breakfast snack and coffee. We got two mochas, an apple cinnamon muffin and a butter croissant. Everything was amazing. Wish we lived closer because I would be here all the time. Really cool ambiance and great customer service
Great stuff
Central location, but mostly underwhelming

I visited Coco and the Director after seeing @sweethomeclt's tiktok. It definitely lived up to the review. They have a wide range of coffees and teas that can be made hot or cold. The seating area was closed due to COVID-19 but the atmosphere was very welcoming and cool. The barista made my order perfectly. Usually I have to alter my coffees but it was delicious! Highly recommend to anyone visiting the Queen City.
People are nice and the food is decent but it takes a while to get anything that's listed on the hotel menu. The cafe menu is almost grab and go with smaller dishes that can be prepared.
Relax chill relax chill it get up ready for anything what's more to say. COFFEE 😝😂
One of the best cafes in Charlotte uptown. Amazing decor and vibe.
Spacious, but cozy

Kind of on the pricey side, but the environment and atmosphere is fantastic. I loved the stepped seating area. It was the perfect place to get comfortable and work on some projects while enjoying some tea.
They have everything you could ever want.

This place looks like a corporate company's vision of how a locally-owned coffee shop would look. I wouldn't give it two stars for being large-scale trendy, though. The coffee was mediocre and my breakfast sandwich had thin eggs (like at a fast food restaurant) and American cheese on it. It just wasn't fresh or delicious.
Best in the town!!
Terrific spot. Good coffee and food options and solid service. Also sells tons of booze if you need that.
Very nice coffee place, to relax, chat with friends or work. The deco is inviting and I like the open concept.
Really sweet staff and great atmosphere
The atmosphere is very nice, laid back, and real conducive to getting work done. The coffee was not bad.

Being from NY it's hard to find places that have your favorite foods or pastries! Today my wife and I were feeling home sick and decided to use mighty google and find that you guys had her favorite pastry! Oh how now it has now become my favorite too! “The cronut” 😍 the cashier was so nice and helpful!! We will definitely be back!
Coffee is ok, little expensive I would say. The stuff is rude and unprofessional. Would never come back and never recommend it to anyone
Prices are alright but a great location for coffee & meetup for any purpose including just broad games. Bring your own or play the ones they provide!
Great atmosphere and coffee
great
Mid afternoon drip coffee, almond croissant (delicious) and work on laptop. Comfortable, not crowded, easy wifi, outlets. Perfect mid afternoon stop.
Excellent coffee and sandwich 👍
Loved it!
great coffee shop in the city. i stopped in on my way to the airport. the staff was nice and the shape was super cozy
nice

Coco and the Director is a very unique and fun coffee shop. While you'll pay a little more for your drink, the ambience is very conducive to study or work. I have spent many hours here getting work done while I sip on one of their delicious coffees. The staff is very friendly, and they also serve alcohol as well. Great place!
wow
I love the cool vibes I get there I will definitely past the good news about this pleasant place
Coffee was bad. Way too much foam, even for a cappuccino, milk was burnt and not smooth at all, extraction was very bland. However, the decor is nice and the space is bright and warm.
Good food, funky atmosphere.  Enjoyed stopping in and hanging out.
You would think the capucino would be better than Starbuck since it is not a chain coffee shop but it is not.  The atmosphere is nice though.
Amazing tea!
I enjoy the creative atmosphere here and the strange music.
Friendly  and great service .
Nice place!! beatiful music and food!!
Best in Town!
They make a really good chai tea. Good place to hangout and friendly staff.
Good coffee, great people working there, plenty of room, not cheap though

Coco is one of my favorite coffee shops in Charlotte. The service is always great, the employees are all super nice and friendly (especially Morgan), and the coffee is amazing! I love the new holiday flavors too!

Pretty cool place. If you have the time to sit down, there is plenty of space. Lots of area to just chill work on your laptop, study, enjoy coffee, etc. Service was good, staff was very friendly. Coffee was really good, they make a good pour over.
Place is super urban but cozy...definitely a place to chill or work.  Coffee was delicious and the kronut... Amazing, can't wait to visit again when back in town!
Affordable  coffee in an eclectic atmosphere.
Love the coffee and good service!
Very nice place hidden in uptown. Great place to sit with friends and enjoy sweets and coffee and also great place to study and read.
Great atmosphere. Ok coffee.
Nice
Awesome coffee and tea selection. Great seating areas. Loved it!
Great atmosphere and house made syrups!
Friendly staff and great atmosphere
Coffee & beer. Beer & coffee. Enough said. Lol. 5 stars.
coffee is mediocre but the decor and setup of the place is top tier!
Great coffee.. you must try their cronut
The design is impressive! But menu didn't surprise.
The team that works here is very friendly and fast...coffee is great and a good place to meet co-workers.
Great coffee, very cute place. Also very good smoothie!
Love coming to this place such a fun place to get coffee and hangout ❤️
Great atmosphere (for a date, hangout, or studying) and nice staff! Will definitely go again!

I've been wanting to sample a cronut and walked down for one today and a sandwich for lunch.  The Sammie was huge, but still over priced....around $9-$10.  I also had a cronut for $6 and it was huge as well.  While I enjoyed the cronut, I found it entirely too sweet.  As a result, I don't ever foresee having another one.  The sandwich was overly salty and wasn't something I'd ever want again or be willing to pay that price for it.  It was a nice comfortable atmosphere, though they should remove that smoke thing with the Halloween decoration by the front door cause nobody wants to walk through that!
Great coffee, lovely atmosphere! Plenty of space to work or chat.
Lunch hours are not posted and always changing. Today I was told that lunch stops at 1:30. ONE THIRTY PM? Really. I'll just go to Reid's for lunch and not even bother with this place.
Cool vibes and great service.  The homemade cronuts go fast!

I have patronized this establishment on more than one occasion, and have, each time, found the baristas to be superb. Top notch. Real "Johnny-on-the-spot" types. 10 out of 10, would recommend. And I should like to take a moment to specifically endorse.....Caitlin? Kaytlin? Qaetlihn? Ckaeytt-Lynn? It's 2019, spelling is hard
Nothing beats amelias.. the pastry choice is small.
Nice space, great vibes, good tea and a great place to study! Love it here.
Great cold brew and latte!
$8 for a specialty coffee drink, no thanks
The coffee is really good, but the scenery is better. Nice decor with a projector screen for entertainment and hella electric outlets.
Turkey sandwich was not good. $$
Good coffee offset to a degree by bad acoustics

Cool place, didn't get coffee but the lady did. The seating accommodations here is interesting. They have tables and chairs but they also have shelf like style seating with cushions where you could literally lay down.
All aesthetic purchased by the  Marriott company. Pastry was stale coffee was mediocre. Service would be better at a Dunkin' Donuts to be honest.

This coffee shop is the most unique and cool shop I've ever visited. The staircase sitting structure is totally something to rave about. I wish I lived closer, I would come here to work every day. Other than the beautiful set up, the coffee and pastries are excellent!
Great coffee and plenty of seating. It's also open later than most coffee shops, which is nice.
Excellent favor, spacious, comfortable for working
Coffee is awful
The pastries are awesome! I had the blueberry muffin and my wife had a almond croissant. Coffee was ok
friendly staff, good atmosphere to get some work done & delicious coffee
One of the coolest coffee shops I've been to. Tasty drinks & pastries and great environment
A cool little coffee shop with a ton of seating. Great for some quiet reading or coffee with friends. They also have a delicious selection of pastries. We got one of the cronuts and it was amazing!!
As far as atmosphere, this may the best I've ever been to. Right in the heart of downtown Charlotte, you have plenty of space to work and talk with friends.
Always a great cup of coffee served with a smile and a warm greeting. Great way to start your day!
Good coffee. Great atmosphere.
Great coffee and pastries. Their friday fried chicken sandwich is always good and the banh mi one was great by Sammy!
Lovely place but you can't get good reception on your phone. 🤷🏾‍♀️

My Boys and I enjoy this amazing place every time we stop by here. People should appreciate this place more, The employees are just friendly and naturally amusing. Definitely our favorite coffee shop in town
This place is ridiculous. Why is this happening? It feels like a poorly maintained student dining hall.
A little pricey but very good coffee
The cashier was very nice! She made conversation with us and made us feel like one of her friends !
Great coffee, smoothies and atmosphere!
The ambience is pretty good just as their service and coffee.

Trendy spot with great customer service. My only negative is the music is a little too loud making it challenging to have a conversation without being close or talking loudly (neither are appropriate for business meetings).
The decor is nice but the service was not.
Best place evaaaaa
Great coffee and breakfast sandwiches and very attentive staff!

Wasn't the best cup of coffee I've had, but that couldve been my error in what I ordered. Lots of options for milk/cream in your coffee.  Nice menu. Make sure you ask them to warm your muffin before they hand it to you. You can NOT hand it back to them to heat up  lol. Odd, but whatever.  The cranberry orange muffin tasted pretty good, even though we couldnt have it warmed up. Nice environment. Cool layout. Staff was normal, nothing to write home about. Probably wouldn't give it a second try.
Not the best place to get a good cup of coffee.
The Coco smoothie is delicious!!! I love it. The coffee is good too.
This place has an awesome atmosphere.

coffee tasted horrible, I asked for them to make room for almond milk and the lady making my coffee was too busy chatting that she did not leave room for my milk. bad service as well, I expected better.
Amazing coffee and location is really eye catching
Beautiful chill Cafe in downtown Charlotte with excellent pastries and homemade smoothies and perfect coffee

Very disapointed. Left in tears due to rude young man behind the counter. He literally talked down to my husband and me the entire time and took a condescending and flippant tone for absolutely no reason. To the manager's credit, she did apologize for the way we were treated and offered to refund the items I no longer wanted.
Best service. Kenya... she's wonderful, followed every bit of my order perfectly. Love this place.

The pastries were delicious and amazing atmosphere. Very calm and soothing. The service was very nice. The pour over coffee takes a lot longer than I'm used to, but tasted good. Cannot express how good the pastries were. Highly recommend the Mexican chocolate.
Good coffee great to hangout an net work
Great atmosphere, friendly staff. The seats and decor are really cool.

Modern establishment that is a great spot for professional meetings as well as catching up with an old friend. Not only is it a great environment but offers yummy pastries with good dirty chai lattes.

Great coffee and plenty of seating/outlets for lingering. They have some unconventional type seating in there.  It's a place worth checking out.  I didn't love the Cronut I had but that's not their fault.  Cronuts aren't my bag I think.

We moved to Charlotte about 7 months ago and have tried every coffee shop/house/spot within walking distance (2ish miles) of our central-Uptown apartment. Coco and the Director has the best, most consistent coffee and service out of all of them. We love the relaxed, welcoming vibe, the mix of spaces to enjoy (from toddler friendly to quiet corners for work or study to group spaces for gaming), and the absolutely flawless lattes. My husband and I have walked a well out of our way to go there many times now, and I've never had a cuppa, regardless of what I've ordered, that didn't feel like a warm hug on a cold day.
Delicious drinks, even better ambiance. Thanks a bunch guys!
One of my favorite coffee shops in Charlotte.  Great for a quick pastry, workspace or coffee in a great centralized location.
Great atmosphere. Great coffee. Had a bullet proof smoothie too... perfection. – worked for 5 hours here. couple hours upstairs and a couple on the cushion stairs/pyramid. Friendly.
Awesome recipes
Wonderful service from very friendly staff! Raspberry tea is the best ever!!
Great mocha and chai tea latte. Interesting seating and decor. They have a few board games.
Coffee is not bad but not the best, great spot to do homework or hangout
Great cup of coffee!
One of the coolest coffee houses I've ever been to!
Staff were super friendly.  The cinnamon & sugar Cronin was worth every calorie, delocious.  Love the space and the effort to make it a comfortable setting for meetings, students and working solo.
A very nice and chill spot. A good place to relax and get some work done ie. on your laptop or read a book. The coffee and pastries are pretty good as well!
Great cafe for everything but coffee.
Incredible coffee and even better muffins and sandwiches. Highly recommended for breakfast lovers
Good atmosphere and central Uptown location.

Love this place. If I lived in Charlotte I would hang out here all the time. They are connected to the Marriot hotel and it was very convenient. The atmosphere was very inviting and comfortable. They even have meeting space In the back. The service was very friendly and helpful with menus selections. The coffee was really good. I tried two of their cronuts and they were amazing. I tried the cinnamon and the chocolate and wanted to buy a box and take them home with me they were so good. I would definitely come here again.

One of our favorite coffee spots in Uptown Charlotte! This place opens very early (6am) and closes late so it's perfect for early morning coffee or as a place to finish up work late into the evening. The interior seating area is one of the reasons  that helps make this cafe stands out from the others. The coffee and selection of pastries (especially the croissants and cronuts) are amazing as well. Finally, the baristas are kind and helpful. To see and experience what the cafe is like, visit our Instagram page @kukoomedia !
It's my favorite place in Charlotte to go study! Great atmosphere and great coffee!
(Translated by Google) great  (Original) Buenísimo
Great place to mingle with friends! Love the environment and great coffee!
Great atmosphere. Not the best prices but nice anyway.

Great cooll coffee shop and co-working space. They do a fantastic job of making this place feel hip and rustic despite the fact that it's in an office building. Coffee is great. Food is awesome.  Line moves quickly.
Coffee is great. The staff is amazing. I wanted heavy cream in my house blend coffee and the staff ran out and grabbed it from the adjacent restaurant to accommodate my ask, all with a smile :)
Excellent coffee and good studying environment
This place is quite interesting. It is definitly a real cool spot and if you like coffee I would suggest it.
Coffee was okay, service takes far too long for how few customers there are. Like the location and environment but it could be much better.

Always a great place for lunch, assuming the day's sandwich is something you'd like. Also good for coffee and related drinks, but I go primarily for the kitchen.  The seating is nice for camping out and the best views of the street make ita nice place to relax for a bit. Great for a small party, like you and a friend, or solo.

In between the chaos is this great coffee shop.It's in Marriot it has two entrances one from the street and other from Marriot lobby. They have two different seating areas one is on the left which is more if you want to sit alone and study or work. Other is the lab where you can book the table for meetings many meetings and interviews were going on there.Coming to the coffee they have amazing local roasts which you can try. Baristas are great they are very friendly. They have a variety of cronuts, croissants, loaves of bread. They even have sandwiches, soups, and salads.

This place is always fun. A little expensive for the pastries and coffee (but on par for most of Charlotte), but the atmosphere is nice. The barista today suggested that we just go with whatever she suggested based on her questions. I said chocolate and she asked spicy and I ended up with this Thai Chili Mocha Latte. It was fantastic.
There's a lady who I swear is Honey boo boo all grown up . Took her forever to care about checking out my item for purchase. Environment and decor is so nice that you really can't give it bad rating.
One of my favorite coffee shops in Charlotte!
Pretty good.  Groovy hipster place.  Seating is  "Google" if you know what I mean. Limited selection.  Was open on NYD which was helpful.
Love the vibe of this place. Very chic and cool. Definitely recommend going either alone or with friends and regardless of whether you go with your laptop for work or fun with friends.

The best thing about Coco and the Director is the seating arrangement. There are so many places to sit and a large projector that they use for movie nights. I also really like the atmosphere and decor - it's pretty hip. My only complaints are the price of the coffee and food, and the options. I guess the pricing isn't really surprising since it's connected to a Marriott.
Staff is friendly, coffee is good

What an amazing coffee house! They offer lactose free options and vegan baked items, in addition to regular offerings. The blueberry muffin was really good. It was my first visit, but I'll definitely be back. Workspace friendly, you can sit at a table or literally on the stairs...large seat pillows are provided. Apparently you can also reserve the larger tables on the hotel-side of the shop. Those are tucked away in the back, if you will. Really inviting and work centric vibe. If you aren't motivated this place will get you there!  Its attached to the Marriott so that is ideal as the location is downtown and on street parking is hard to find. Free wifi. Good coffee. Unique gift items for sale. Two levels. Chalkboard art. Lactose-free options...wins had by all! Go check it out!
So good I decided to return again -- same day! Cozy, unique setting (especially when cranking out solo projects) and a warm staff.
A very chill environment with great coffee and food. Perfect place if you want to study, read, or just get a good cronut.
Great coffee
Great coffee and awesome customer service!!!! The banana nut loaf is the best I've ever had!!!!
Coffee was decent. No private sitting. It's a communal place, both physically and politically.
Awesome atmosphere, relaxed, cozy and friendly. Had a great fried chicken sandwich for lunch and an afternoon coffee. Very enjoyable.
Great coffee, fresh pastries and breakfast sandwiches, and excellent service.
Open 365 all year long
It was average with good service
Super friendly staff, awesome atmosphere. Love stopping her for my daily muffin and coffee!
Great place great atmosphere great coffee
Great coffee and amazing friendly staff
Go for the Flat White and the daily lunch special
Great customer service. Neat and very tasty coffees and desserts. Don't miss the almond croissant!
Great place, great section of pastries...
If I lived in Charlotte this would be my hangout...totally cool
Great service cool place
Awesome vibe, chill music, unique intimate stadium steating with yoga lounge pillows, books, board games, super friendly staff, great sandwich. Going back!
It is a nice place to study and a good place to stop at if you are touring. It has a elevator for wheelchairs and nice staff with delicious drinks to choose from. The bomb!
So adorable, plenty of seating, and in a fantastic location. Very nice people and good prices!
Great place to meet friends do a little business or even drink some coffee.
Such a cool coffee spot. Huge interior with lots of places to sit and plug your laptop in.
Nice
This is a good quiet place to work

Love, love, love this place! Amazing coffee and incredible staff. I can't remember her name...but she works there almost everyday I visit...and she is the sweetest & funniest! She can put a smile on anyone's face, even at 7am! Huge fan!

This place is excellent for hanging out in for work or study, lots of seating options. It can get really loud in here though... I always bring headphones. The espresso drinks are ridiculously overpriced for the amount you get... I recommend sticking with coffee or coldbrew, which are both good & plenty strong. Baked goods are tasty, staff is nice enough & generally efficient.
Really cool and good coffee
Actually a Starbucks. Cozy spot and good service.
I had a good hot chocolate here. The staff was very friendly. Good place to study or have a small gathering.
Overpriced cappuccino.  Great scene for work/study but coffee is average.
Good staff good place
Coffee was good, atmosphere was neat, lady at the register was a bit rude.
Cool place to hang out, matcha tea was very good.
regular
Cool place to hangout with a small group. The coffee is pretty good too.
Best Chai Latter I've had; and the Coffee Cronut was delicious!!
Cool place to get work done when Starbucks is too noisy downtown
Great coffee (and other food/drink)place to study. Also, I like their movie nights throughout the year!
Terrific space with location in Marriott Hotel. Great coffee and pastries. They have cronuts.
Neat place to hangout with friends or just by yourself!
Very cute place and loved the chai latte!

I have had coffee in many places. Puerto Rico, Oregon, Florida, Kentucky and North Carolina just to name a few but I've never tasted such a malty, creamy and decadent coffee like the one in Coco and the Director. Last time I went I actually ended up drinking 2 cups of coffee it was so good. Granted I was wired for about 24 straight hours but well worth the jitter-pumped-caffeine-infuse-hardcore hangover. If there's a better coffee than this one please  by all means tell me so I could try it because this is at the top of my list.  The location of the store and the setup is beyond what you can imagine. Big stair-like steps adorn the main lounge where you can sit and drink your coffee but there are pillows you actually sit on or use them for your back. Not your thing? Ok, no prob. There are tables throughout the whole location to maintain the traditional way of drinking "un cafecito" in the coffee shop.  The staff are all super friendly and very knowledgeable of the coffee and where it comes from. They are so friendly, in my opinion, that they're the type of people I'd like to have as friends.  Wait for me because I'll be returning soon to order my two cups of coffee. Or better yet, prepare me my 32 oz jug because I'm ready for more! Keep up the excellent work or great products and great service, every single time.
One of my favorite coffee spots. They have great cold brew and cappuccinos. It's a popular and great Meetup place as well.
Great coffee
Nice place, chill vibe
Excellent coffee and smoothie location in Marriott.
Hip spot,  good prices despite being in center city
LEGIT ‼️
First time my daughter visited a real coffee shop. The lady that helped us as super nice and helped her find what she liked. Awesome customer service. Would highly recommend this place.
Cute little coffee shop. I got a dirty chai and it was tasty.
Very good coffee and very unique interior.

Very beautiful cafe (one of the most beautiful ones I've been too actually). The pillowed staircase is great for families with children :) I ordered a decaf cappuccino and it was delicious (trust me it's rare to find good tasting cappuccino when you re limited to decaf). The BLT sandwich was good too (food is prepared from Marriott next door so it might take some 15' to be prepared)
Very nice coffee shop.  Service could of been better.
Love this place
We stopped here everyday we were in Charlotte, as our hotel was right across the street. The staff was friendly and the coffee, treats, and sandwiches were great! The best part? They're open late!
Sorry to say the coffee was weak and the English Muffin sandwich we ordered was returned. Must have microwaved the egg a little too long. Tough and over cooked.
Awesome place with plenty of seating and good coffee!

Great place located next to Marriott with inside access to hotel. Locally roasted coffee with a mild robust flavor. Food choices are in the same category as large chain coffee shops but the quality is superior. I had the egg bacon and pimento breakfast sandwich very tasty. I just started routinely meeting in Charlotte and this will always be my go to coffee shop. Great place.
Unique, clean, modern, slightly quirky coffeehouse with small market, games, tvs, and more!
Good chill spot...its a cafe but they force you to buy right away or leave bo real chill time first if needed like most
Best coffee spot in Charlotte! Love the aesthetic and there are areas for meetings. Highly recommend!
The staff is not that personable, and the coffee is medicore.
Funny and personable barista. Awesome  ambiance. Books and board games available. Great variety and delicious pastries.my new favorite coffee ahop
Great place to get coffee! Tons of different seating type choices to make sure you can be comfortable is whatever manner you think will make you productive.
Very nice coffee and a handy spot in downtown Charlotte. It actually connects into the hotel as well which is quite handy for guests. Lots of seating areas and some snacks available here too.
Always greeted with a smile and they have great vegan options!
Pleasant, peaceful, comfy, friendly atmosphere...and they have food...and cool music playing in the background... and sometimes they show movies! Mostly, a great place to study. 😊
Best place to zone out with a great cup of coffee and get work done. Staff is welcoming and friendly, as are the customers!

Just what an out of town coffee nut needed. Great section of pastries... Great selection of roasts on tap for quick grab and go. They also do pour over for those who have time and like this being process. The staff were great, congenial and good conversationalists while you wait. Next time I'm back in town I'll be stopping in again.
This coffee shop feels like a mini co-working space. Lots of room to chill and meet with friends, fueled by quality craft coffee and unique treats.
Awesome coffee shop!
An awesome coffee place. Although the coffees were a little costlier I wouldn't mind paying a little more for the ambience. Me and my childhood friend enjoyed playing the Scrabble board game.
Delicious food, great coffee and super helpful service! It was quick and overall a great spot!
Relaxing place
Awesome location and great decor. Coffee was meh at best with a fairly high price.
Fantastic coffee shop with a few bakery items. Very cool interior space with unique seating. Just beware of the price of beer and other items...
Great atmosphere. Excellent flat white. Friendly staff.
MJ was so kind. Very, very hospitable. Also, the mocha I ordered was incredibly delicious. Clean place, warm atmosphere. I went back to this place twice. This and the Halal Truck. Great spot.
Nice café, with friendly barista.
Chill cafe vibe with cool decor - I could see myself having alot of dinner or lunch meetings here. I would only suggest that they keep up with the cleanliness of all of the seating and pillows

Love love love the atmosphere here. Espresso drinks, croissants, and even beer and wine were excellent. The tea selection is great, but tea shouldn't be $4 a cup. Baristas were jovial and very helpful.
My favorite coffee shop in Charlotte

My new favorite coffee shop in Charlotte! I got a Iced caramel latte and now I crave it everyday! Definitely one of the best lattes I've ever had. The atmosphere is awesome as well. And, there's board games for anyone to play!
By far the best place to grab a coffee while reading a book or completing a work assignment uptown.
The ambience is chill and a perfect place for a link up with friends, the bae or your start up co-founder.
Great cappuccinos
Great atmosphere! Services up a few different food and beverage items than other places.

Great decor and layout, coffee was ok. Friendly service. My Croinut was stale kinda disappointed. I didnt taste the latte or mix drinks. 4 stars because of the croinut will change maybe to 5 stars once i return and try other products if its good

The coffee is lovely but terribly expensive, and the cronuts are pricey too...but they're sooooo worth the indulgence. I love the atmosphere and decor, and the  collaborative work spaces with ample plugs/outlets.
It's such a beautiful, aesthetically pleasing coffee place. Perfect spot to read, work, or just hang. The espresso was better than most places I've been to.
Great ambiance and coffee. Plenty of seating and pretty good pastries as well.
Nice place but a bit stuffy. Coffee isn't very well made.
Good hot chocolate,  nice  calm atmosphere
Great little coffee shop!
Cashiers and coffee brewers are super friendly! Decent quality and fair priced coffee! Nice seating locations
Great coffee atmosphere!
Hip as heck
One of my favorite spots for coffee in the QC.
Definitely the best coffee shop in the area.
Good coffee. Great sandwiches.
Very small tasty capuchinofor $4 but really cool space
There is seriously nothing bad to say about this place.  Best coffee shop environment in Uptown, you can meet, work, or hang out here.  Lunch specials are amazing, and staff is great.
Nice staff; this place has the industrial look that I like. Also, a great place to study/chill.
Might just be the best coffee and Charlotte. Really really great pour over and really chill spot to hang out and enjoy.
Good coffee. Awesome environment. In the heart of Uptown.
Staff is awesome
Horrible management, will overbook your reservations for customers they "like better"
The location is great! Met a client there to do a closing and requested assistance from the employee and he stated he didn't have time. So we left and they loss a order for 10 drinks.
Great coffee, friendly and helpful service, and really nice environment to relax

This place is great. Friendly staff, simple and easy to follow menu, and an amazing atmosphere. Vertical floor seating, with cushions, allows for more places to sit. Board games and books make it comfortable and easy to feel welcome. I wish we had a place like this is High Point.
dope atmosphere
I love it over there, I like the small shop, the baked goods, the coffee and the friendly staff
Excellent environment and coffee.
Cool place to eat, drink and hangout. I got a flat white expresso, connected to the Wi-Fi, and got some work done.

I love the ambience, I love the customer service, but the teas are legitimately disgusting and burnt tasting. The cronuts are overpriced and not worth $6. The sandwiches are good and the coffee is good but that is only half the menu. I would come here again to chill, but I won't and can't recommend this place. Hopefully they will fix these problems, because I really want to like this place.
Decent coffee in a great location with loads of work space and seating. Definitely a fun spot for caffeine in the city.
Love visiting here whenever I'm uptown and have time between plans/appointments
Great location, parking was a bit tricky but worth it, the cheese plate. You guys, I was skeptical but the wine yummy
Cool place and they should turn down the music in the am to be more conducive for meetings.
I love the style of the place, its very woodsy and has a creatively artsy vibe to it. The coffee is great and so is the food. Service is alright.
Ambiance and coffee are good, but I wish they had more variety for snacks and food.

Very hip and trendy place. If I could give it a 3.5 stars I would because the atmosphere was great, but there really isn't enough seating. The WiFi was down half the time I was there and food prices were very expensive, but the coffee was great and fairly priced. Overall I will probably be back, but not anytime soon.
Cool place
Great place.  Great hanging out with my bride.  Muffins and Kronuts were fabulous.  MJ, who waited on us could not have been sweeter. Thanks. One of my new favorite places!

Hip place with multiple levels and various seating settings. We went for the Wednesday wine and color. They provide the coloring books and markers, wine is $5 a glass and pastries are 50% off. We had some delicious Moscato and a hot cinnamon cronut. Right in the heart of Charlotte, we will be back.

Stellar atmosphere. Right across the street from the Charlotte City Club. It's a little over-priced but its good coffee. Very cozy, very hip, kind of rustic. I can always count on HGTV playing on the overhead projector.
Loved the atmosphere in this place.  Good coffee and a comfortable spot to work or read.
After a long hump day Jackie put the biggest smile on my face! She was so sweet and very helpful! Thank you for being so kind!
Very cool atmosphere,  service was awesome! Can't wait to go back when I visit Charlotte!

I love this place for the ambience. Coco and the Director has an atmosphere that encourages people to come in and sit for a while. The staff is always friendly and right outside of coco is another sitting area in the Marriott hotel. It's simply an awesome place. You can have coffee or a variety of beers here. The one negative is everything is awfully expensive. There are bottles of water that are as high as $8 bucks. This still remains one of the best kept secrets in Charlotte.
WOW!!!!
There is an outstanding atmosphere , nice quiet and really good place for work or have a talk with friends.
Great coffee. Unique tiered seating layout. Right on Trade + Tryon (dead center Charlotte uptown). Hip shop connected to the Marriott.
Wonderful place to chill, read a book  drink coffee and pick up some unique gifts. Very laid back place. Coffee is better than most other places and cold drinks are a good alternative

I love Coco, they have good space to hang out or meet with friends. They used to have a scary cream pitcher that poured way too much, but they seem to have replaced it. The coffee is not cheap but it's good, and the lunch specials are always on point.
It was ok
Accidentally overpaid $80 for a coffee, realized when I got home in S.C.. They found a way to get back my cash. Great people, great management, 10/10 would go back
Not very inviting. Service was blah. Just a typical coffee shop.
Good coffee, rude employees.
Very cool local coffee shop with an awesome atmosphere
Great coffee and service. Trendy!
Very nice coffee and tea spot. They offer lots of healthy bottles drinks too. Great seating in a variety of settings for any type of gathering. Also had a muffin that was delicious.
Upscale Coffee shop smack in the middle of Uptown Charlotte

My favorite coffee shop in Charlotte. They have great drinks, great atmosphere and a great selection of beer, wine and snacks.  My only complaint is that they don't serve hot food all day (only during lunch I believe.)  There are good co-working spaces to get meetings and group work done. They have interesting (although expensive) items for out-of-towners looking to get something local. The seating is fabulous. There is a book trade, and great windows for people watching.  There are lots of plugs throughout so you could stay all day if you wanted to...  The staff is great every time I go in. Overall I love this place!

Peaceful Atmosphere!!! I decided to attend the Wine and Coloring event with my husband on 8/2! I figured it would be nice to try that for my birthday! The cashier was awesome, his personality made me felt like I've known him my whole life. He was just that cool :) Even he gave me a birthday gift, which was very sweet of him! But, I love the space, the decor, and how quiet it was! I will definitely be back! Oh yea, the prices were dirty cheap, the Banana Bread was ahhhhhhhhmmmmmmmmmmmaaaaaazzzzzziiinnnnnnnnnggggggggg! Keep making that!!!!!

Cool coffee shop with very unique tiered seating. Sometimes they have live sports playing on the projector. This place is more about the decor than the service or their food and beverage offerings. Each time the service is just a little too slow for a coffee shop or the pastry is lackluster. The coloring and wine night is a cool idea and there is nothing better than hanging out in a coffee shop drinking wine. Problem is pour size varies greatly by the staff member and even then sometimes the same person has wildly different size pours. Go for the atmosphere, but don't expect to be blown away by anything else. Really it's just a good place to hang out.
If you've never been here, go, now. and bring your favorite book.  They'll provide the beverage.  I adore this spot.

I am beginning to have chronically bad customer service issues at this shop. I visit here pretty often and I can count on 2 fingers when I've gotten good treatment from the baristas. I'm a female and I used to work in hospitality, so I know to be friendly and expect friendly. I ordered a croissant warmed up. A LONG minute later got a croissant NOT warmed at all. And with the lack of enthusiasm from my barista guy already, I was just trying not to go from annoyed to pissed. I come here for the atmosphere and location, but buyers beware- friendly service is a serious hit or miss.
Environment was relaxing, creative, and functional! Decent selection of foods and beverages.
The coffee is good depending on the barista. Some days it will be amazing and others it will be worse than Dunkin Donuts. Some don't really understand what 30 pounds means.
One of my favorite coffee spots in uptown. It has a unique atmosphere and seems like a great place to hangout.

Great beverages, decent choice of snacks, great atmosphere, perfect white noise, not too loud or quiet, clean restrooms, plenty of seating, outlets everywhere, friendly people. Perfect coffee shop, couldn't ask for anything more in a place to work or have a conversation honestly.

I love the atmosphere and the layout of this coffee shop. The Cronut was original and delicious but the coffee was a little higher in quality than Starbucks but lower in quality than other coffee shops in Charlotte.
Maybe because I come early in the morning, but the two times I've been the staff has been mediocre at best. Not very friendly. Dope spot in other facets. I'm
The staff was very friendly. When the grinder broke, they offered me a free pastry and a free coffee during my next visit.
The staff is very nice the are is made for u to focus the snacks are great and not to wxpensive the whole feel is just good vibes!!!!

Very cool coffee shop with a lot to offer! The decor, atmosphere and total vibe is nothing like the chain experience everywhere else! I would actually hangout here if I felt like working outside my office! Very Well Done!
(Translated by Google) try their Hario for over  (Original) try their Hario pour over

Rhe place is beautiful and the coffee is good, but it looks like the emplyees are extremely overwhelmed. The manager should put more employees to work in the place, which is big. When I went there somebody took my drink and the barista had to make another one ro me. He attended me very well, but was visually exhausted.

A unique and cozy new spot in the heart of uptown. Whether you're there to study, grab a coffee and lunch to go or just to get Sugarrman's famous Kronut (croissant + doughnut) I highly recommend Coco. They also have a book trading bookshelf inside the store which I love!
One of my favorite coffee shops of all time. Great setup, delicious coffee, awesome atmosphere.
Great place to hang out and have a cup. The atmosphere and seating really make this place special.
The atmosphere is what makes this coffee shop! The coffee is great and they serve cronuts! It can be a little bit challenging to find parking.
Great atmosphere, I've had better specialty coffees artisanal crafted.  But taste alright.
Excellent coffee and pastries, a seating ziggurat, and the best trivia night in town!
excellent coffee and staff.  much better than Starbucks
Great coffee, tea, sandwich, snacks, and pastry options. Staff is friendly and there are also lots of interesting gifts and non-food items of interest. Service is quick even when there's a line.
Super friendly staff, lots of seating options, ample outlets, good food. It's a great place for a meeting, a quick meal or getting some work done. I especially like their tea selection.
Thoroughly enjoyed this coffee shop. The interior oozes creativity and collaboration. They also serve pour over which has been hard to come by these days.

Best space I've seen in Charlotte that marries community, collaboration, entrepreneurial spirit, support of local coffee teas & food that I've experienced in CLT.  If you are looking for a great coffee or tea or simply in need of an easy cafe type bite while working in an open and energetically aligned space come here.  I had the Turkey BLT which was good & a Dirty Chai that's spot on!  No cons....
Warm and cozy environment, welcoming friendly staff, and good, decently priced coffee. I would definitely recommend this place when visiting uptown Charlotte!
Nice place for coffee, staff was very friendly and helpful.
The tea is good, the people are nice, and the seating is amazing!
Great atmosphere and good design. Didn't get to explore many menu options but seemed like a great place to get together to study or just chill out
Good coffee (and reasonably priced) but they're asking north of $12 for a grilled cheese...
This is a great place to grab a morning coffee, afternoon treat, or after work beer. Great atmosphere, tons of outlets & USB chargers and friendly staff. I've found my new favorite coffee shop.

Definitely a "cool" space and I love the little retail store concept baked into the coffee shop too . . . but the server last weekend was determined to make me feel like a fool bc I didn't know my coffees. . . I'm a newbie and was hoping for a bit of an "education" into what drink to order (maybe describe the difference between a cappuccino and a cafe au lait?)  However, despite the fact that there was no line at all behind me she proceeded to ask me (repeatedly) what I wanted to drink and tap her foot impatiently as I posed a variety of questions striving to glean a little bit of knowledge out of her . . .  Disappointing when you consider that a few minutes of time invested now could've introduced me to my fav new coffee shop :-(.
Cool place. Great Americano.
Love this place! Finally a chill place to read, drink coffee and study
Best coffee shop in Charlotte! Feels like NYC, London etc. way to go Charlotte! Amazing job
The atmosphere here is sleek, modern, and very down-to-earth. Prices are reasonable and staff is friendly. Highly recommend.
